data: About six o’clock on an evening in the early part of a recent November, the drowsy quiet sometimes pervading police headquarters was rudely broken by the precipitate entrance of a young man, who made his way hurriedly to the door marked, in neat gilt letters, “CHIEF OF POLICE.”

About six o'clock on an evening in the early part of a recent November, the drowsy quiet sometimes pervading police headquarters was rudely broken by the precipitate entrance of a young man, who made his way hurriedly to the door marked, in neat gilt letters, "CHIEF OF POLICE."
The silver blade: The true chronicle of a double mystery
Walk, Charles Edmonds, 1875-1943?; Wenzell, A. B. (Albert Beck), 1864-1917 [Illustrator]
